alert.note: Alert for Atoka (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 09 at 7:27AM CST until March 11 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Clear Boggy Creek near Caney affecting Atoka County.
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. OKC005-100130- /O.NEW.KOUN.FL.Y.0004.230309T1327Z-230311T1200Z/ /CANO2.N.ER.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NO/ 727 AM CST Thu Mar 9 2023 ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Clear Boggy Creek near Caney. * WHEN...From this morning to Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, The creek remains mostly within its banks in western Atoka County and the northeastern edge of Bryan County. Some high stages on small feeder streams result in very localized... short-term overflows of mainstem bottomlands. Low-lying fields are briefly cut off from easy access. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM CST Thursday the stage was 21.7 feet. - Forecast...The Clear Boggy Creek is expected to rise to a crest of 25.0 feet just after midnight tonight. - Action stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
